00220 
00221 //
00222 // rdh:rdl = ra*rb
00223 //
00224 // This special form of multiply is used to produce a double-width result
00225 // in rdh:rdl. If a single-width result is required, use vmimtBinopRRR.
00226 //
00227 // Notes:
00228 // 1. 'op' must be vmi_MUL or vmi_IMUL
00229 // 2. 'rdh' and/or 'rdl' may be VMI_NOREG (to discard that part of the result)
00230 //
00231 void vmimtMulopRRR(
00232     Uns32      bits,
00233     vmiBinop   op,
00234     vmiReg     rdh,
00235     vmiReg     rdl,
00236     vmiReg     ra,
00237     vmiReg     rb,
00238     vmiFlagsCP flags
00239 );
00240 
00241 //
00242 // rdd = rah:ral/rb; rdr = rah:ral%rb
00243 //
00244 // This special form of divide is used to divide a double-width dividend
00245 // preserving result or remainder or both. If a single-width result without
00246 // remainder is required, use vmimtBinopRRR.
00247 //
00248 // Notes:
00249 // 1. 'op' must be vmi_DIV or vmi_IDIV
00250 // 2. 'rdd' and/or 'rdr' may be VMI_NOREG (to discard that part of the result)
00251 // 3. 'rah' may be VMI_NOREG - in this case, it defaults to 0 for vmi_DIV and
00252 //    the sign extension of 'ral' for vmi_IDIV
00253 //
00254 void vmimtDivopRRR(
00255     Uns32      bits,
00256     vmiBinop   op,
00257     vmiReg     rdd,
00258     vmiReg     rdr,
00259     vmiReg     rah,
00260     vmiReg     ral,
00261     vmiReg     rb,
00262     vmiFlagsCP flags
00263 );
00264 
00265 //
00266 // compare(ra, rb); flag = <cond>
00267 //
00268 void vmimtCompareRR(
00269     Uns32        bits,
00270     vmiCondition cond,
00271     vmiReg       ra,
00272     vmiReg       rb,
00273     vmiReg       flag
00274 );
00275

00284     vmiReg       flag
00285 );

00296 );

00324     Uns32        bits,

00326     Uns64        c,
00327     vmiReg       rb,

00329 );
00330 
00331 //
00332 // Use this prefix operation immediately prior to vmimtBinop* call with a
00333 // shift/rotate operation (any of vmi_ROL, vmi_ROR, vmi_RCL, vmi_RCR, vmi_SHL,
00334 // vmi_SHR or vmi_SAR) to override the default shift mask for that operation.
00335 //
00336 // By default, register shift/rotate amounts are masked to the size of the
00337 // shifted argument minus 1 (i.e. 1-byte shifts are masked to 0..7, 2-byte
00338 // shifts to 0..15, 4-byte shifts to 0..31 and 8-byte shifts to 0..63). Using
00339 // this prefix allows the mask to be overridden. For example, the ARM processor
00340 // can handle shifts in the range 0..255, which can be specified using a shift
00341 // mask of 255 immediately prior to a shift operation.
00342 //
00343 void vmimtSetShiftMask(Uns8 mask);
00344

00545 );

00550 //

00552     Uns32         bits,
00553     Addr          offset,

00556     memEndian     endian,
00557     memConstraint constraint
00558 );
00559 
00560 //
00561 // rd = mem[ra+offset]  (when ra!=VMI_NOREG)
00562 // rd = mem[offset]     (when ra==VMI_NOREG)
00563 // NB rd is destBits, memory is memBits
00564 //
00565 void vmimtLoadRRO(
00566     Uns32         destBits,
00567     Uns32         memBits,
00568     Addr          offset,
00569     vmiReg        rd,
00570     vmiReg        ra,
00571     memEndian     endian,

00573     memConstraint constraint
00574 );

00673 
00675 // INTER-INSTRUCTION CONDITIONAL AND UNCONDITIONAL JUMPS
00677 
00678 //
00679 // Use this prefix operation immediately prior to vmimt*Jump* calls to specify
00680 // masking of target and link addresses. For example, specifying a mask of
00681 // 0xfffffffe will cause the LSB of target and return addresses to be ignored
00682 // (for processors with 32-bit code addresses).
00683 // This function affects the behavior of instruction fetches only - to modify
00684 // the behavior of loads and stores in a similar way, use vmirtSetLoadStoreMask.
00685 //
00686 void vmimtSetAddressMask(Uns64 mask);
00687 
00688 //
00689 // Perform an unconditional direct jump to 'toAddress'. If 'linkReg' is not
00690 // VMI_NOREG, then 'linkPC' should be placed in this register. This
00691 // variant is for jumps with no delay slot instructions.
00692 //
00693 void vmimtUncondJump(
00694     Addr        linkPC,
00695     Addr        toAddress,
00696     vmiReg      linkReg,
00697     vmiJumpHint hint
00698 );
00699 
00700 //
00701 // Perform an unconditional direct jump to 'toAddress'. If 'linkReg' is not
00702 // VMI_NOREG, then 'linkPC' should be placed in this register. This
00703 // variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot instructions.
00704 //
00705 void vmimtUncondJumpDelaySlot(
00706     Uns32         slotOps,
00707     Addr          linkPC,
00708     Addr          toAddress,
00709     vmiReg        linkReg,
00710     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00711     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00712 );
00713 
00714 //
00715 // Perform an unconditional indirect jump. The target location is in register
00716 // 'toReg'. If 'linkReg' is not VMI_NOREG, then 'linkPC' should be placed
00717 // in this register. This variant is for jumps with no delay slot instructions.
00718 //
00719 void vmimtUncondJumpReg(
00720     Addr        linkPC,
00721     vmiReg      toReg,
00722     vmiReg      linkReg,
00723     vmiJumpHint hint
00724 );
00725 
00726 //
00727 // Perform an unconditional indirect jump. The target location is in register
00728 // 'toReg'. If 'linkReg' is not VMI_NOREG, then 'linkPC' should be placed
00729 // in this register. This variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot
00730 // instructions.
00731 //
00732 void vmimtUncondJumpRegDelaySlot(
00733     Uns32         slotOps,
00734     Addr          linkPC,
00735     vmiReg        toReg,
00736     vmiReg        linkReg,
00737     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00738     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00739 );
00740 
00741 //
00742 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00743 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is pointed at by toAddress.
00744 // This variant is for jumps with no delay slot instructions.
00745 //
00746 void vmimtCondJump(
00747     vmiReg      flag,   // byte
00748     Bool        jumpIfTrue,
00749     Addr        linkPC,
00750     Addr        toAddress,
00751     vmiReg      linkReg,
00752     vmiJumpHint hint
00753 );
00754 
00755 //
00756 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00757 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is pointed at by toAddress.
00758 // This variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot instructions.
00759 //
00760 void vmimtCondJumpDelaySlot(
00761     Uns32         slotOps,
00762     vmiReg        flag, // byte
00763     Bool          jumpIfTrue,
00764     Addr          linkPC,
00765     Addr          toAddress,
00766     vmiReg        linkReg,
00767     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00768     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00769 );
00770 
00771 //
00772 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00773 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is pointed at by toAddress.
00774 // This variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot instructions. If the
00775 // branch is not taken, instructions in the delay slot are annulled - see also
00776 // vmimtSkipIfAnnul.
00777 //
00778 void vmimtCondJumpDelaySlotAnnul(
00779     Uns32         slotOps,
00780     vmiReg        flag, // byte
00781     Bool          jumpIfTrue,
00782     Addr          linkPC,
00783     Addr          toAddress,
00784     vmiReg        linkReg,
00785     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00786     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00787 );
00788 
00789 //
00790 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00791 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is in register 'toReg'.
00792 // This variant is for jumps with no delay slot instructions.
00793 //
00794 void vmimtCondJumpReg(
00795     vmiReg      flag,   // byte
00796     Bool        jumpIfTrue,
00797     Addr        linkPC,
00798     vmiReg      toReg,
00799     vmiReg      linkReg,
00800     vmiJumpHint hint
00801 );
00802 
00803 //
00804 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00805 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is in register 'toReg'.
00806 // This variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot instructions.
00807 //
00808 void vmimtCondJumpRegDelaySlot(
00809     Uns32         slotOps,
00810     vmiReg        flag, // byte
00811     Bool          jumpIfTrue,
00812     Addr          linkPC,
00813     vmiReg        toReg,
00814     vmiReg        linkReg,
00815     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00816     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00817 );
00818 
00819 //
00820 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00821 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is in register 'toReg'.
00822 // This variant is for jumps with 'slotOps' delay slot instructions. If the
00823 // branch is not taken, instructions in the delay slot are annulled - see also
00824 // vmimtSkipIfAnnul.
00825 //
00826 void vmimtCondJumpRegDelaySlotAnnul(
00827     Uns32         slotOps,
00828     vmiReg        flag, // byte
00829     Bool          jumpIfTrue,
00830     Addr          linkPC,
00831     vmiReg        toReg,
00832     vmiReg        linkReg,
00833     vmiJumpHint   hint,
00834     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00835 );
00836 
00837 //
00838 // Perform an unconditional direct jump to 'simPC1', execute 'slotOps'
00839 // instructions at that address, and then jump to 'simPC2'. If 'slotCB' is
00840 // non-null, it will be executed on completion of the instruction sequence at
00841 // address 'simPC1'
00842 //
00843 void vmimtEnterDelaySlotC(
00844     Uns32         slotOps,
00845     Addr          simPC1,
00846     Addr          simPC2,
00847     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00848 );
00849 
00850 //
00851 // Perform an unconditional indirect jump to 'toReg', execute 'slotOps'
00852 // instructions at that address, and then jump to 'simPC2'. If 'slotCB' is
00853 // non-null, it will be executed on completion of the instruction sequence at
00854 // address 'toReg'
00855 //
00856 void vmimtEnterDelaySlotR(
00857     Uns32         slotOps,
00858     vmiReg        toReg,
00859     Addr          simPC2,
00860     vmiPostSlotFn slotCB
00861 );
00862 
00863 //
00864 // Valid in delay slot only.
00865 // If getNextPC is True, move the program counter of the instruction to be
00866 // executed immediately after the delay slot instruction into targetReg.
00867 // If getNextPC is False, move the target address from the preceding jump
00868 // instruction into targetReg (this differs after vmimtCondJumpDelaySlot for a
00869 // branch that is not taken).
00870 //
00871 void vmimtGetDelaySlotNextPC(vmiReg targetReg, Bool getNextPC);
00872 
00873 //
00874 // Skip remaining actions for the current instruction if it is being annulled.
00875 //
00876 void vmimtSkipIfAnnul(void);
00877 
00878 
00880 // INTRA-INSTRUCTION CONDITIONAL AND UNCONDITIONAL JUMPS
00882 
00883 //
00884 // Allocate a new label. Insert it where required using vmimtInsertLabel below.
00885 //
00886 vmiLabelP vmimtNewLabel(void);
00887 
00888 //
00889 // Insert a label previously created by vmimtNewLabel at the current location.
00890 //
00891 void vmimtInsertLabel(vmiLabelP label);
00892 
00893 //
00894 // Perform an unconditional jump to the passed local label.
00895 //
00896 void vmimtUncondJumpLabel(vmiLabelP toLabel);
00897 
00898 //
00899 // Perform a conditional jump if the condition flag is non-zero (jumpIfTrue)
00900 // or zero (not jumpIfTrue). The target location is the passed local label.
00901 //
00902 void vmimtCondJumpLabel(vmiReg flag, Bool jumpIfTrue, vmiLabelP toLabel);
00903 
00904 //
00905 // Perform a conditional jump if the result of a previous native function call
00906 // (called with vmimtCall) is non-zero (jumpIfTrue) or zero (not jumpIfTrue).
00907 // The target location is the passed local label.
00908 //
00909 void vmimtCondJumpLabelFunctionResult(Bool jumpIfTrue, vmiLabelP toLabel);
00910 
00911 //
00912 // Test the register value by performing bitwise AND with the passed constant
00913 // value, and jump to 'toLabel' if condition 'cond' is satisfied.
00914 //
00915 void vmimtTestRCJumpLabel(
00916     Uns32        bits,
00917     vmiCondition cond,
00918     vmiReg       r,
00919     Uns64        c,
00920     vmiLabelP    toLabel
00921 );
00922 
00923 //
00924 // Compare the register value by performing subtraction of the passed constant
00925 // value, and jump to 'toLabel' if condition 'cond' is satisfied.
00926 //
00927 void vmimtCompareRCJumpLabel(
00928     Uns32        bits,
00929     vmiCondition cond,
00930     vmiReg       r,
00931     Uns64        c,
00932     vmiLabelP    toLabel
00933 );
00934 
00935 
00937 // MORPHED CODE CONTROL
00939 
00940 //
00941 // Terminate the current code block by forcing a jump to the next instruction
00942 //
00943 void vmimtEndBlock(void);
00944 
00945 //
00946 // Get the processor built-in blockMask into the passed 32-bit register
00947 //
00948 void vmimtGetBlockMask(vmiReg blockMask);
00949 
00950 //
00951 // Set the processor built-in blockMask to the passed constant value
00952 //
00953 void vmimtSetBlockMaskC(Uns32 blockMask);
00954 
00955 //
00956 // Set the processor built-in blockMask to the passed 32-bit register value
00957 //
00958 void vmimtSetBlockMaskR(vmiReg blockMask);
00959 
00960 //
00961 // 'modeMask' is a bitmask selecting a subset of bits from the processor
00962 // built-in block mask (set using vmimtSetBlockMask* or vmirtSetBlockMask
00963 // functions). When the code block is executed, this function validates that the
00964 // bits selected by 'modeMask' match the processor block mask state when the
00965 // code block was generated. If there is a mismatch, the code block is
00966 // regenerated.
00967 //
00968 void vmimtValidateBlockMask(Uns32 modeMask);
00969 
00970 //
00971 // This function works exactly as vmimtValidateBlockMask except that the
00972 // block mask register is a general processor register of up to 64 bits instead
00973 // of the 32-bit built-in block mask.
00974 //
00975 void vmimtValidateBlockMaskR(Uns32 bits, vmiReg r, Uns64 modeMask);
00976 
00977 //
00978 // Mark the current code block with the given tag. Such blocks may be either
00979 // deleted or preserved when blocks are flushed using function
00980 // vmirtFlushTargetModeTagged. Tagging is cumulative: multiple calls to
00981 // vmimtTagBlock combine tag values using bitwise-or.
00982 //
00983 void vmimtTagBlock(vmiBlockTag tag);
00984 
00985 
00987 // CONNECTION OBJECTS
00989 
00990 //
00991 // rd = get(ca)
00992 //
00993 // Perform blocking get from connection object 'connReg'. 'bits' must match the
00994 // connection width. If no data is available, this processor will block until it
00995 // becomes available, at which point 'updateCB' will be called.
00996 // If 'peek' is True, data read will not be removed from the connection object.
00997 // If 'rd' is VMI_NOREG, the current processor will stall until data becomes
00998 // available but no data will be read.
00999 //
01000 void vmimtConnGetRB(
01001     Uns32           bits,
01002     vmiReg          rd,
01003     vmiReg          connReg,
01004     Bool            peek,
01005     vmiConnUpdateFn updateCB
01006 );
01007 
01008 //
01009 // rd = get(ca)
01010 //
01011 // Perform non-blocking get from connection object 'connReg'. 'bits' must match
01012 // the connection width. If no data is available, 'flag' will be set to False
01013 // and 'rd' will be unchanged; otherwise, 'flag' will be set to True and 'rd'
01014 // will hold the value read from the connection.
01015 // If 'peek' is True, data read will not be removed from the connection object.
01016 // If 'rd' is VMI_NOREG, 'flag' will indicate whether data is present but no
01017 // data will be read.
01018 //
01019 void vmimtConnGetRNB(
01020     Uns32  bits,
01021     vmiReg rd,
01022     vmiReg connReg,
01023     Bool   peek,
01024     vmiReg flag      // byte
01025 );
01026 
01027 //
01028 // put(ca, ra)
01029 //
01030 // Perform blocking put to connection object 'connReg'. 'bits' must match the
01031 // connection width. If the connection object is full, this processor will block
01032 // until space becomes available, at which point 'updateCB' will be called.
01033 // If 'ra' is VMI_NOREG, the current processor will stall until there is space
01034 // to put in the connection object but no data will be put.
01035 //
01036 void vmimtConnPutRB(
01037     Uns32           bits,
01038     vmiReg          connReg,
01039     vmiReg          ra,
01040     vmiConnUpdateFn updateCB
01041 );
01042 
01043 //
01044 // put(ca, ra)
01045 //
01046 // Perform non-blocking put to connection object 'connReg'. 'bits' must match
01047 // the connection width. If the connection object is full, 'flag' will be set to
01048 // False; otherwise, 'flag' will be set to True.
01049 // If 'ra' is VMI_NOREG, 'flag' will indicate whether there is space to put in
01050 // the connection object but no data will be put.
01051 //
01052 void vmimtConnPutRNB(
01053     Uns32  bits,
01054     vmiReg connReg,
01055     vmiReg ra,
01056     vmiReg flag     // byte
01057 );
01058 
01059 
01061 // SIMULATOR CONTROL
01063 
01064 //
01065 // Explicitly suspend simulation of the current processor on completion of the
01066 // current simulated instruction to allow other processors in a multiprocessor
01067 // simulation to run. Simulation of the processor will restart when all other
01068 // runnable processors have executed.
01069 //
01070 void vmimtYield(void);
01071 
01072 //
01073 // Halt the current processor on completion of the current simulated
01074 // instruction. The processor will remain halted until restarted by a call to
01075 // vmirtRestartNext or vmirtRestartNow.
01076 //
01077 void vmimtHalt(void);
01078 
01079 //
01080 // Interrupt simulation of the current processor on completion of the
01081 // current simulated instruction and return from simulator invocation.
01082 //
01083 void vmimtInterrupt(void);
01084 
01085 //
01086 // Immediately end simulation of the current processor. Simulation of other
01087 // processors in a multiprocessor platform will continue.
01088 //
01089 void vmimtExit(void);
01090 
01091 //
01092 // Immediately end simulation of the current processor. Simulation of other
01093 // processors in a multiprocessor platform will also end on completion of the
01094 // current time slice.
01095 //
01096 void vmimtFinish(void);
01097 
01098 //
01099 // Cause the processor to advance immediately to the end of its scheduled time
01100 // slot or until the next timer event, as if it had executed nop instructions
01101 // in the interim.
01102 //
01103 void vmimtIdle(void);
01104 
01105 //
01106 // Indicate that the current instruction should be executed atomically in a
01107 // multiprocessor simulation
01108 //
01109 void vmimtAtomic(void);
01110 
01111 
01113 // INSTRUCTION COUNTING
01115 
01116 //
01117 // rd = <instruction count>
01118 //
01119 void vmimtICount(Uns32 bits, vmiReg rd);
01120 
01121 
01123 // EMBEDDED CALL INTERFACE
01125 
01126 //
01127 // Add various argument types to the stack frame
01128 //
01129 void vmimtArgProcessor(void);
01130 void vmimtArgUns32(Uns32 arg);
01131 void vmimtArgUns64(Uns64 arg);
01132 void vmimtArgFlt64(Flt64 arg);
01133 void vmimtArgReg(vmiRegArgType argType, vmiReg r);
01134 void vmimtArgRegSimAddress(Uns32 bits, vmiReg r);
01135 void vmimtArgSimAddress(Addr arg);
01136 void vmimtArgSimPC(Uns32 bits);
01137 void vmimtArgNatAddress(const void *arg);
01138 
01139 //
01140 // Deprecated name for argument type functions
01141 //
01142 #define vmimtArgDouble vmimtArgFlt64
01143 
01144 //
01145 // Make a call with all current stack frame arguments and the given attributes
01146 //
01147 void vmimtCallAttrs(vmiCallFn arg, vmiCallAttrs attrs);
01148 
01149 //
01150 // As above but generate a function result (placed in rd)
01151 //
01152 void vmimtCallResultAttrs(
01153     vmiCallFn    arg,
01154     Uns32        bits,
01155     vmiReg       rd,
01156     vmiCallAttrs attrs
01157 );
01158 
01159 //
01160 // Backwards-compatible vmimtCall
01161 //
01162 #define vmimtCall(_ARG) \
01163     vmimtCallAttrs(_ARG, VMCA_NA)
01164 
01165 //
01166 // Backwards-compatible vmimtCallResult
01167 //
01168 #define vmimtCallResult(_ARG, _BITS, _RD) \
01169     vmimtCallResultAttrs(_ARG, _BITS, _RD, VMCA_NA)
01170 
01171 
01173 // SMP PROCESSOR SUPPORT
01175 
01176 //
01177 // Return the equivalent vmiReg of the passed VMI register object for the
01178 // Nth-level SMP parent of the current processor (where level 0 is this
01179 // processor, level 1 is the parent, level 2 is the grandparent etc).
01180 //
01181 // This function must be used to create VMI register descriptions when the
01182 // current processor can change its Nth-level SMP parent processor at run time
01183 // (see vmirtSetSMPParent in the VMI Run Time Function API).
01184 //
01185 vmiReg vmimtGetSMPParentRegister(vmiReg r, Uns32 level);
01186 
01187 #endif
